[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests()] [URL query parameter overflow] Can extremely long query strings with hundreds of parameters cause the url::form_urlencoded::parse() to consume excessive memory or CPU, degrading admin service performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests()] [Weak hash function] Does using sha256::digest() for passcode authentication provide sufficient protection against rainbow table attacks, or should this use a memory-hard function like Argon2? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests()] [Hash timing attack] Is the comparison between sha256::digest(passcode) and passcode_sha256 constant-time, or can attackers use timing differences to perform byte-by-byte hash cracking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Block ID spoofing] Can an attacker request blocks with forged block IDs to cause the consensus DB to return incorrect blocks, potentially revealing information about unfinalized or orphaned blocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_blocks()] [Transaction extraction integrity] Does extract_txns_from_block() properly verify that extracted transactions match the block's transaction root hash, or can batch manipulation cause invalid transactions to be returned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests()] [Error message information disclosure] Do error responses from INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR return detailed error messages with stack traces, file paths, or internal state that could aid attackers in reconnaissance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Spawn_blocking error exposure] If spawn_blocking() fails due to thread pool exhaustion, does the error message reveal information about node resource limits or internal threading configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::mempool::mempool_handle_parking_lot_address_request()] [BCS serialization error leak] When bcs::to_bytes() fails, does the error message expose internal data structure layouts or memory addresses that could aid exploit development? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::malloc::handle_dump_profile_request()] [Filesystem path disclosure] Does returning the full path to dumped heap profiles (e.g., /tmp/heap-profile.timestamp) leak information about server filesystem layout or temporary directory locations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_blocks()] [Empty result ambiguity] When dump_blocks() returns empty results, can an attacker distinguish between 'no blocks exist' vs 'specified block not found' to enumerate valid block IDs through timing or error message differences? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Last vote exposure] Does exposing last_vote data reveal which validator this node belongs to, enabling targeted attacks on specific validators based on their voting patterns? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Timeout certificate leakage] Does exposing highest_tc (timeout certificate) reveal consensus timing information that could be used to predict when the network is vulnerable to liveness attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Round number disclosure] Does dumping blocks with round numbers allow attackers to calculate consensus latency, identify slow validators, or predict future leader election outcomes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Author identification] Does exposing block.author() for all blocks enable network-wide validator behavior analysis, identifying which validators propose empty blocks or exhibit Byzantine behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [Quorum certificate analysis] Does dumping all QCs reveal signature aggregation patterns, validator set composition, or voting participation rates that could be exploited for targeted attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_blocks()] [Payload disclosure] Does block.payload() in the debug output expose transaction payloads before they're finalized, enabling front-running or MEV extraction from validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_quorum_store_db()] [Batch enumeration attack] Does calling get_all_batches() allow attackers to enumerate all pending batches across all validators, building a complete view of unconfirmed transaction activity for MEV? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_consensus_db()] [get_data() atomicity] Is consensus_db.consensus_db().get_data() atomic, or can concurrent consensus operations cause the returned data to be inconsistent across the tuple of (last_vote, highest_tc, blocks, qcs)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::consensus::dump_blocks()] [Block iteration order] Does iterating through blocks in dump_blocks() reveal the insertion order or storage layout of the consensus DB, leaking information about consensus progression? (Low)

[File: aptos-labs/aptos-core/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::Context] [Database handle invalidation] Can the Arc<DbReaderWriter> or Arc<StorageWriteProxy> become invalid while still held in the RwLock, causing use-after-free when admin requests try to read from closed databases? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests() - #[cfg(target_os = 'linux')]] [Platform-specific code bypass] Can an attacker on non-Linux systems access unimplemented but routable endpoints like /profilez or /threadz that return NOT_FOUND instead of proper errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::serve_requests() - #[cfg(unix)]] [Unix-specific attack surface] Are the malloc stats and profile dumping endpoints properly protected on Unix systems, or do they expose more attack surface than Linux-specific profiling endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::malloc::dump_heap_profile()] [Filesystem permission issues] Does dumping heap profiles to /tmp/ with predictable naming allow local attackers to race the file creation and replace profiles with malicious data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::malloc::dump_heap_profile()] [TOCTOU on profile path] Can an attacker create symbolic links at the predicted profile path before dump_heap_profile() writes, causing heap data to be written to arbitrary locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/lib.rs] [Module: server::start()] [Runtime.spawn() panic handling] If the spawned async task panics during request handling, is the panic properly caught and logged, or does it silently crash the runtime without administrator notification? (Medium)
